text: The Lynx du Collège Édouard-Montpetit women's ice hockey team represents Collège Édouard-Montpetit. Their home games are contested at the Aréna Émile Butch Bouchard in Longueuil, a south part of Greater Montreal, Canada. In addition, the team is a member of the Hockey collégial féminin RSEQ. Lynx logo The Lynx gathering around the bench discussing strategy ==Team history== On April 2004, the Ligue de hockey féminin collégial AA announced that two new women's hockey teams would debut for the 2005-2006 season. The Lynx were founded in the autumn of 2004. In 2009, the Lynx gained their first prominent attention when they eliminated the Dawson Blues in a 2009 playoff as they claimed their first championship.(French) Hockey féminin: Roxanne Douville arrête Dawson, http://exruefrontenac.com/sports/hockey/3665-hockey-feminin A second consecutive championship confirmed their superiority in Quebec women's collegiate ice hockey.(French) Hockey féminin: Un deuxième championnat de suite pour les Lynx, ==Season by season results== Note: GP = Games played, W = Wins, L = Losses, T = Ties, OTL = Overtime losses, GF = Goals for, GA = Goals against, Pts = Points. {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Regular season|- ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="7.5%" | Year ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="7.5%" title="Games played" class="unsortable" | GP ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="7.5%" title="Wins" | W ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="7.5%" title="Losses" | L ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="7.5%" title="Ties" | T ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="7.5%" title="Ties" | OTL ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="7.5%" title="Goals for" | GF ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="7.5%" title="Goals against" | GA ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="7.5%" title="Points" | Pts |- align=center |2005–06|| 27 || 15 || 10 || 0|| 2|| 101 || 75 || 32 |- align=center | 2006–07 || 27 || 12 || 14 || 0|| 1|| 70 || 103 || 25 |- align=center | 2007–08 || 27 || 12 || 13 || 0 || 2 || 92 || 89 || 26 |- align=center | 2008–09 || 24 || 19 || 5 || 0 || 0 || 105 || 61 || 38 |- align=center | 2009–10 || 21 || 19 || 1 || 0 || 1 || 136 || 27 || 39 |- align=center | 2010–11 || 21 || 19 || 1 || 0 || 1|| 139 || 42 || 39 |- align=center | 2011–12 || || || || || || || || |} ==Season standings== {| |- | style="background-color:#B3B7FF; border:1px solid #aaaaaa; width:2em;" | | = Indicates First Place finish |} {| |- | style="background- color:#CCFFCC; border:1px solid #aaaaaa; width:2em;" | | = Indicates Playoff championship |} {| class="wikitable" !Year !Reg.
